subSubSection.paragraph:
Batonota monocera : Gemminger and Harold 1876: 3645
( nomen nudum ).

Remarks. The description of
D. parallela
by Blanchard (1837) was brief and highlighted only diagnostic features of the subgenus
Dorynota s. str.
, such as punctate pronotum and elytra and conspicuous spinose projection at the median region of the elytra. Boheman (1854) redescribed the species, with further details of body color, elytral and pronotal shape and punctation, and in his discussion,
P. parallela
was compared sizewise with
D. pugionata
, being slightly shorter and wider and subequal in size to
P. ensifera
. Monrós and Viana (1949) transferred
P. parallela
to
Dorynota s. str.
but did not justify the taxonomic change.

After examination of the lectotype , paralectotype , 247 specimens identified as
P. parallela
obtained from DBET, DZUP, MMUE, MNHN, MNRJ, MZH, MZUSP, and SMNH, and male and female terminalia, I observed that the species does not exhibit the diagnostic features of
Paranota
, and here its original combination is reinstated.

Geographical Distribution.
Recorded from Argentina (Misiones), Bolivia (Beni, Guarayos, José Miguel de Velasco ), Brazil (Pará, Goiás, Mato Grosso, Bahia, Minas Gerais, São Paulo, Rio de Janeiro, Santa Catarina), Ecuador , Paraguay (Distrito Capital, Itapúa), and Peru ( Cuzco ) (Borowiec and Świętojańska 2014)
.

Type Material.
Lectotype
: Brasil // Type // Mhn // NHRS-JLKB \ 000020986 //
Lectotype \ des. L. Borowiec ( SMNH )
;
Paralectotype
( Figs. 85–86 ): Museum Paris \ Bolivie \ (Chiquitos) \ D`Orbigny 1834 // 7316 \ 34 //

.
